name: Doubletree Hotel Norfolk Airport

reviews.text: This hotel is nowhere near Hilton or Doubletree standards. It is in a rundown mall in a very bad part of town. I've lived in bad military towns, but this one made me feel unsafe. The parking lot had groups of people hanging around drinking. Anyone could walk into the hotel and into the elevators, which made me feel very unsafe.
reviews.title: Scary, unclean, unsatisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself wasn't horrible, but it wasn't nice or anything.
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.disliked: — Front desk staff, location attached to a mall (JC Penney)

reviews.text: I checked out early and fought to get out of being charged for the remaining night.
reviews.title: Not good
Unkempt Appearance
reviews.text: We stayed here because we wanted to visit Virginia Beach over Labor Day and all the beach hotels were booked. I expected more from Doubletree. The hotel is directly attached to a shopping mall and near a college campus. When we arrived there were a lot of very loud students hanging around celebrating a Norfolk St. football game, and the parking lot was full of lots of trash.

reviews.title: Good service, comfortable rooms
reviews.text: Checking in was a nightmare. We had reserved a room with one king-size bed through Expedia. First the hotel gave us a room with two doubles. When we refused it, they put is in a room with water damage and mildew smell (from the recent visit of Hurricane Ernesto). We refused this room and asked for a similarly-configured room on a lower floor. They moved us down, but the room was like the first---no king size bed! We refused that room and they moved us back upstairs, to a room they claimed was not water-damaged and had a king-size bed. When we entered the room, guess what? Two double beds. By this time we were very tired, didn't want to put up with any more "attitude" from the front desk staff and unwilling to try a 5th room! So, we settled for the smaller bed.
Good location; attached to a mall. For those of us who get our exercise by walking, the mall is really handy in case it's raining/too hot/too cold outside.
reviews.title: Thoroughly Adequate
We found it very pleasant
reviews.text: Stay away from the "edges" of the rooms. The "middles" of the rooms are clean enough, but people with tender stomachs shouldn't look in corners, especially near the sliding balcony doors. Bathroom cleanliness, soaps, amenites are above average; including the corners.
Property recently implemented free internet service, but you have to remember to inform the front desk at check-out since the $9.95/day charge still appears on your bill.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: I was given coupons for free continental breakfasts at the attached restaurant, or $2.50 off a cooked breakfast. Don't bother. Pointed out cleanliness/sanitation issues two days in a row to staff and management; nobody seemed to care. Phoned county Health Department; maybe they can fix. Plenty of restaurants nearby, however.
reviews.title: Loved the Doubletree
odd location
reviews.text: On balance, I'd stay there again. Just stay away from the restaurant, and from the far corners of your room.

My stay was 04JUN08 - 07JUN08. After my winning bid through Priceline I read the reviews on TA and started to become concerned. I assumed I would be checking into a hotel attached to an half empty mall filled with dollar stores and video arcades. A mall is a mall is a mall ect.... and this mall seems to be doing fine ie: Macys, JCPenney ect. and a barber shop that is open until 8pm which I found amazing..... I got a haircut too. My assigned room was fine, cold AC, comfortable bed and extremely clean room and bath.
reviews.title: Convenient location.

likes.liked: — Convenient location to highway and tourist attractions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My stayed was booked entirely throught Priceline with a winning bid at $51/nt
reviews.title: Decent airport hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night during Memorial Day weekend. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is on a mall property -- the mall itself is not all that great, but it does have a movie theater....
reviews.title: Scary
Beware
reviews.text: Pros:
+ Very courteous staff
reviews.title: Unsavory

reviews.text: My cousin will sleep anywhere, me on the other hand I'm very picky about where I sleep and bathe, unfortunately since I'm still on a college student budget I can't afford 5 star.
reviews.title: DoubleTree Cookies

likes.liked: — Cookie! Wish I had received more than one.

reviews.text: My cousin booked this hotel for us which came out to be $134 dollars for one night, and I will say it wasn't really worth it, I don't know if we saved or not through priceline. I know that ocean front in VA beach is really hard to get if you aren't booking ahead of time, so we had to stick with what was free on such short notice, something 20 minutes away from the beach in Norfolk.
reviews.title: disappointed
This place is very sad
reviews.text: The hotel was a little difficult to find through Mapquest's directions.

I was expecting roach motel in a really bad side of town based on the reviews I read here. Two girls in a bad town scared me. However my cousin who's been in Norfolk a bit assured me it wouldn't be too bad.
reviews.title: So-so

likes.liked: — Warm chocolate cookies given at check-in.

reviews.text: The town was not as bad as I thought, the hotel is in a mall, once you enter the mall you can go into the hotel. Parking was a little difficult. I've been to bad towns and this just seemed like a typical VA Beach/Norfolk town, granted it's not the rich side of Norfolk, we went to where the Marriott is and that's in a way nicer side of town (I think Granby Street).
reviews.title: Its all about location here

likes.disliked: — Small bathroom, carpet soiled and faded.

reviews.text: I believed that the Doubletree Hotels would be nice no matter where they were located. I took the airport shuttle to the hotel and found it in the middle of a mall. There were cars all over with booming sound systems that could be heard from my eighth floor room. My windows were shut and the air on and they still could be heard. I didn't feel safe leaving or entering the hotel due to several groups of loitering teens. I tried walking the mall, but again, there were all sorts of groups just hanging around and acting disorderly.
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.text: The hotel staff was nice and helpful. When I had a request, they did their best to satisfy me. The entrance to the hotel was well taken care of, except the fact that it is right next to a main entrance of the mall.
reviews.title: Didn't feel safe

reviews.text: I entered my room and found the tissue box in the bathroom had some kleenex pushed back into it like someone had taken too many and tried putting them back in. The shower sitll had an open bottle of shampoo sitting in the soap holder...disgusting. Other than the bathroom, the room was generally clean and neat. The beds were very comfortable. Some TV stations did not work because of a satilite problem. The rooms were quiet except for hallway noise. There were several kids running around the hallway which was disturbing. If I am ever in Norfolk again, I would find another hotel to stay at
reviews.title: It's okay

reviews.text: This hotel is located in/over a mall. The parking lot was littered with alcohol, and several people were sitting in the cars watching everyone most of the night. I didn't really feel safe arriving or leaving this hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel in an unusual location

reviews.text: The room was good-average for a doubletree. The front desk staff acted as if they wished they were anywhere but at work.
reviews.title: Would not stay there again

description: 14 floor hotel located in the Gallery at Military Circle with 150 stores, Food court, 18 theater movie complex, full service restaurant, lounge, outdoor pool, fitness center, centrally located to interstate and downtown Norfolk and VA Beach.
